name: Pierre-Dominique Zgonec's CV
description:
Welcome to Pierre-Dominique Zgonec's CV!

video game music composer 

 

Do not be afraid: the game’s very short! So you can have a quick overview of my composition skills.

 

Carrer Path:

Young composer trained at Studio Capitale Paris, I began studying the guitar at music school at the age of 9. Then, I continued to learn music on my own, always with this instinct to compose original music. In 2015, I started to use computer music as well as orchestration, a genre that has always fascinated me. I now devote myself to composing for short films, news stories, web videos, dance shows and, of course, video games. In 2019, I began taking lessons with Gilles Alonzo, teacher at Lyon's national conservatory (CNSMD) film scoring class, the greatest Europe-wide. In 2020 and 2021, I was choosen for the « Marché européen de la composition » (European musical composition selection) in Aubagne. I have been a guitar teacher since 2017.

Influences:

My inspirations come from different genres and composers. From rock and pop to ambient and classical/orchestral music. A lot of artist have influenced him: Nobuo Uematsu, Jeremy Soul, Yoko Shimomura,  John Williams, Hans Zimmer, Max Richter, Thomas Newman, James Newton Howard, James Horner, Basil Poledouris, Johann Sebastian Bach, Antonin Dvoräk, Piotr Ilitch Tchaïkovsky but also U2, Coldplay, Hammock and others.

Please, do not hesitate to have a chat with me if you want to talk about a project or just if you need more information: pierredzgonec@gmail.com

Have fun!
